solution_line_template: The first athlete jumped a total of {athlete1_total_jump} feet because {athlete1_long_jump} + {athlete1_triple_jump} + {athlete1_high_jump} = <<{athlete1_long_jump}+{athlete1_triple_jump}+{athlete1_high_jump}={athlete1_total_jump}>>{athlete1_total_jump}

The second athlete jumped a total of {athlete2_total_jump} feet because {athlete2_long_jump} + {athlete2_triple_jump} + {athlete2_high_jump} = <<{athlete2_long_jump}+{athlete2_triple_jump}+{athlete2_high_jump}={athlete2_total_jump}>>{athlete2_total_jump}

The first athlete jumped {athlete1_average_jump} feet on average because {athlete1_total_jump} / {number_of_jumps} = <<{athlete1_total_jump}/{number_of_jumps}={athlete1_average_jump}>>{athlete1_average_jump}

The second athlete jumped {athlete2_average_jump} feet on average because {athlete2_total_jump} / {number_of_jumps} = <<{athlete2_total_jump}/{number_of_jumps}={athlete2_average_jump}>>{athlete2_average_jump}
The average jump of the winner was {winner_average_jump} feet because {athlete2_average_jump} > {athlete1_average_jump}
